verb.description: (of an object or structure, typically a wooden one) make a harsh, high-pitched sound when being moved or when pressure or weight is applied.
examples: the stairs creaked as she went up them

verb.description: Show weakness or frailty under strain.
examples: stock prices creaked to a mixed finish today

noun.description: A harsh scraping or squeaking sound.
examples: the creak of a floorboard broke the silence

origin: Middle English (as a verb in the sense croak): imitative.
